alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:59AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Valley and Phillips Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. Ice jams have been reported in the area, which can impact gauge readings. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26.5 feet, Bjornberg Road north of the Milk River begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Friday the stage was 26.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM MDT Friday was 26.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.3 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 03/04/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
